origDate.note: 13. Dynastie unter Chendjer, der im Bildfeld genannt wird.

origin.origPlace: Abydos Laut PM V, 46 aus dem Osiristempel oder aus der unmittelbaren Umgebung. Dies beruht wahrscheinlich auf der Angabe im Text, da√ü Amenyseneb im Osiristempel Bauarbeiten durchf√ºhrte. Vgl. Lichtheim, 80, f√ºr weitere Gedanken zum Aufstellungsort.

ab.s: The perfect god, lord of the two lands, lord of ritual practices, King of Upper and Lower Egypt, ìçπNimaatnetre(?)ìç∫, given eternal life.
Son of Re of his own body, ìçπKhendjerìç∫, given eternal life, stability and power.
An order to be placed in front of the controller of the phyle of Abydos Amenyseneb, justified, saying:
"See, the works that you have done have been inspected.
As the sovereign praises you, as his ka praises you, spend your good old age in this temple of your god!"
Then it was commanded that the hind quarter of a calf be given to me.
Then it was ordered to place (the following) in front of me:
"Carry out every revision ‚å©of‚å™ that which is in this shrine!"
I acted according to everything that was commanded.
I caused that one made firm every chapel of every god who was in this temple.
Their altars were renewed, together with the great altar of pine that is in front of (the god).
I conducted (it/all this), my heart being beneficient for my god,

An offering which the king gives and Wepwawet, Lord of the sacred land, that he may give sweet breath of life to the Ka of the controller of the phyle of Abydos, Imenyseneb, jusitifed, born of Nebetit, justified.
Praising Wepwawet, Lord of Abydos, in his procession by the overseer of the phyle of Abydos, Amenyseneb, justified, begotten by Waemkau.
